posts.subject: Neptunia Thread
posts.body:

 ==CONTENT==
>Re;Translation of Re;Birth 2
'''Actual version:''' 1.422
'''Download:''' https://mega.nz/#!XBdyxBiI!6X2zMpAT3rYIszGxhpCAdK6CzkMogFXrZlnVGqtcD8M ufile.io/n9fetsif
 
>Re;Translation of Re;Birth 3
'''Actual version:''' 1B
'''Download:''' https://mega.nz/#!aN1FTYJJ!aAokCq94E63OI9s2ovFX-PT9z3azVVU4sjqa6LOB11w ufile.io/uqjljj3p
 
>Producing Perfection audio has been uploaded to MEGA
'''Download:''' https://mega.nz/#F!YERwSbSA!K5DHhnr_wl8jqXwHnVFJFQ
 
'''Stories from /nep/ and /v/ members:''' http://pastebin.com/nPukfP7A
'''Thread OP pastebin:''' http://pastebin.com/ksBnE5tM
 
==QUESTIONS==
>Which game to begin the series with?
Start with Re;Birth 1 to test the waters, then play Re;Birth 2 and/or Re;Birth 3 (with the Re;Translations), and then V-II.
 
>I've heard of bad translations in the Neptunia games, care to tell me more about it?
Translation Statuses are:
''HDN, HDN Mk2 and Victory:'' NISA cancer.
''Re;Birth 1 and V-II:'' Translation is alright, no worries from these ones.
''Re;Birth 2:'' Not obviously bad at the start, but gets much worse as it goes along: in particular Neptune and Ram were screwed hard during localization. However, there is a Re;Translation made on our very own board (see above links).
''Re;Birth 3:'' Better than the original NISA translation in Victory but still quite a lot of cancer. Main game has been retranslated, translators still required to translate DLC content.
''All of the spin-offs:'' Varying translation quality. These range from cancer to mediocre.
I guess no eggplants here

>>be580ddf-7b87-4b4d-b007-5caddee11107

This zeronet documentation is criminally bad. It says I need port 15441. TCP, UDP, both? And on my main page it says 12074. Geez.

It should be fixed now. Try again.

>>59ca2038-dfa4-4efa-b726-64f2c6d31260
>"But more importantly, what do you mean you'd sense it?"
"In the same way I sensed major trouble at Virtual Forest. After all, cause for recent viral monsters boom was located in some cave there."
"You mean the Anti-Crystal? Normal people don't sense it... *sigh*, whatever I hope you're right, I just don't want come back and pick up Linda because you were overconfident."

>"..., yet the day before we didn't see it."
"Considering the location of that prison is in Lastation, it's more likely for them to use cloaking device than magic. Besides, SP cost for that wide effect spell would be way too high to support it for long time."
"Um," Yumi responds, "I heard rumors that they have some kind of SP generating machine that can support the spell for thousands of years... maybe they have one in Lastation too? And actually you only really have to hide the entrance, it's pretty small compared to the whole thing."
"Okay guys, Yumi, please tell me the location, as accurately as you can, then we're going to get the team together and investigate it."
"Sure, but... I want to go with you."
"No, Yumi, it's too dangerous."
"No, it's okay..." she says as she picks up a huge purple dildo, so huge that it could be a smaller person. "I can protect myself!"
"I see you have that dangerously looking device... but can you use it? Plus if you come with us, who will look after Linda?"
"Are you inviting me to a fight? I can show you my skills! And don't worry about Linda, I already told you, I can handle it."

>>0902b65e-291b-4e0e-aeeb-a81d61fc90bc
>"You mean the Anti-Crystal?"
"Yes, if that dark power and Anti-Crystal power are the same."
"Anti-Crystal generates negative Share-Energy, that makes CPUs weak. Dark energy... I don't know what is it, I only heard it about it yesterday from Linda. But if they're the same, Nepgear must have felt it while fighting with Makoto. Did she mention anything like that?"

>"I can protect myself!"
"Your perverted, oversized diclub aside, what is your level? If it's lower than mine, then you can only go to prison entrance before going to Lastation Basilicom with Linda to bring reinforcements here."
"Don't underestimate me!" she shouts and swings her weapon. You're unprepared, so you don't have a chance to dodge it, the jelly-like dildo sends you flying across the room. You crash into the wall, receiving 43HP damage in the whole process.
"Come on, this was just a warming up exercise! Just wait until you see my SP moves!"
